meanings.definition: To make someone feel less important or proud
meanings.sent1: She humbled her friend by praising her achievements.
meanings.sent2: The teacher humbled the student by pointing out his mistakes.
meanings.sent3: He humbled his brother in a friendly competition.
meanings.sent4: The defeat humbled the champion, teaching him a valuable lesson.
meanings.sent5: The wise words of the elder humbled the young listener.

meanings.definition: To lower someone in dignity or importance
meanings.sent1: The scandal humbled the once-respected politician.
meanings.sent2: Losing the game humbled the team in front of their fans.
meanings.sent3: The extravagant party humbled the host financially.
meanings.sent4: The fall from grace humbled the arrogant CEO.
meanings.sent5: The public apology humbled the celebrity in the eyes of the public.

meanings.definition: To be modest or meek in behavior
meanings.sent1: She humbled herself by admitting her mistake.
meanings.sent2: The leader humbled himself before his followers.
meanings.sent3: He humbled himself by wearing simple clothes to the event.
meanings.sent4: The athlete humbled himself by thanking his competitors.
meanings.sent5: The student humbled himself by asking for help with humility.
